author: {'steamid': '76561198040884867', 'num_games_owned': 2433, 'num_reviews': 901, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1413402350}
review:
I have had my eye on this game for a while. Finally picked it up for under a buck, and I gotta say I am quite dissapointed for even that low of a price. This is something I would expect to be a free flash game. It tries hard. I mean the effort is there, but because it is soooo directly comparable to many other games, it falls seriously short. I mean the soundtrack is ok in places, but overall meh. The platforming is easy, and very standard. This game brings *nothing* new to the genre. I just wish it weren't so flippin' similiar to VVVVVV (which is pure art). 

I also question the odd developement decision to make the suicide one button, and the respawn set two. Did anyone really need a suicide button? I never used it, but I certain reset my spawn every 10 feet which was made laborious by having to push two buttons instead of one. 

I also wonder if this game could benefit from not giving the player a set number of lives, but a set number of times they can reset their spawn.

I would stay away from this one for all of the reasons above, plus its under an hour of gameplay from start to finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016437391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1430346452}
review:
"Love" is a fine platformer with flashes of real greatness.

My biggest complaint is with the level design. Most of the levels are fairly by-the-numbers explorations of a single mechanic, using mostly horizontal platforms. It's a shame, because when it deviates from this formula the game comes into its own. In particular, the level "Belly of the Beast" (pictured on one of the trading cards) is fantastic, and shows how rewarding platforming can be when exploring the level is its own reward. If the rest of the game had been up to that standard, I would recommend it unreservedly. 

Still, it's a fun experience, with responsive controls and a good soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048872869', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1705639395}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996550048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1412769424}
review:
Love's got some pretty chill beats and the aesthetic is nice. there are now 15 levels to complete on multiple modes; most of them have interesting set pieces, even if the game essentially has no story. the player-created checkpoint system is a neat gimmick that tallies into your final score, and apparently there's a level creator too but i never tried it. 

however, for being such a short, simple game the core platforming mechanics don't feel as smooth as they could be; maybe i'm just bad though. i'd say this game is worth a dollar at best, but not the regular asking price of three, and even then there's really not enough content in the game to be truly excited about. might be a bit more interesting if you're into speedrunning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027212244', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1701482523}
review:
Love is quite a good game. I don't know why it's named love, but I'm not someone who analyzes names...

Anyway, love is a platformer that is difficult. It is decently difficult - not ridiculous and not super challenging. This game is more for those who like to try to speed-run and like beating the same levels better and better. There's only 15 short levels, and within an hour, I was able to speed-run this game with less than 15 minutes on the counter.

If you like replaying VVVVVV and Super Meat Boy to try to do better than average to really good, then you'll LOVE this game. Otherwise, really think about buying this. Like I said, this game is for those who like speed-running.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039863685', 'num_games_owned': 1423, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1414442629}
review:
Few unfair situations and abysmal visuals, but what we have is a nice, tight platformer for casual play, when you have a few spare minutes (whole game can be finished in about 10 minutes, when you learn the levels, but because of time attack, it does have some replay value).
Don't expect too much, and you will like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061624585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1411825793}
review:
I'm neutral for this game.. I played it for 20-30 minutes and like other people who skipped tutorial, I don't know the X button would change the teleport. I thought this game was unforgiving, but I think I'm wrong.. you just need timing and good memory to remember all the obstacle (which means you need many trials and errors).
I can't say I love it, because the previous game I played was vvvvvv (about 2 hrs before playing this game and I love it) and it's .. totally different scale, this game' level design feels just "normal" , "classic" and "frustating" (not challenging) and I don't see any stories and I don't know the setting of this game. I hope I'm wrong, let see a bit more.. however, I would recommend this game for people who love retro platformer which require skills and good memory

author: {'steamid': '76561198026575104', 'num_games_owned': 2072, 'num_reviews': 428, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1426876563}
review:
This platformer has simple (retro) graphics, simple music....and it is simply difficult. ^^
This game offers you all in the first 15 minutes and guides you through 3 stages.
I stage (0-5 min) : WTF is this and WTF is going on here?
II stage (5-10 min) : crying, screaming, shouting, cursing yourself and the game and the way you lose lives
III stage (15+ min) : you reach almost zen-like peace with your mind and soul and you don't feel any anger anymore (probably as side effect of raging in second stage).
:)

author: {'steamid': '76561198088883421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1523261154}

author: {'steamid': '76561198096556700', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1629686962}
review:
Love is an orthodoxed 2D platformer which strives in challenging gameplay and minimalistic graphics. You play a character which is a few blocks tall and wide, and to complete the game, you must brave this character through the many levels in which this game has to offer.

All of the levels in Love can vary in terms of difficulty, ranging from a few blocks to jump over, to dissapearing platforms which stay on the level for only a few seconds. Anyone who can complete the game (which, by the way doesn't take that long) has achieved something.

There is a variation of game-modes in which you can choose from, from "Easy Mode", to "YOLO Mode" this game can keep you busy for hours. No matter what mode or difficulty you play this game on, Love never ceases to grasp & hold the unique atmosphere of the game. Which is why I like it.

How this game manages to do this is the distinctable level design and the soundtrack, which is absolutely fantastic.

If you enjoy platforming games, or are looking for some neat singleplayer games to keep you from your boredom, take a look at Love.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977323553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1407818065}
review:
Some background, I originally planned to purchase this on my OUYA, and I played the demo that was available there for a long time. Loved it, and bought it the moment it became "available". Only problem was the game wasn't supposed to be available for purchase. (They basically took my money with no deliverable). I contacted the Dev (Fred) and he was more than happy to give me support on the issue. Fast forward two months and it turns out OUYA locked his listing (security key issues). Being the nice guy he is, Fred let me transfer my purchase to steam. All in all the dev is a real good dude.

(TL;DR = Great developer support for all of his customers reguardless of platform)

Now onto the actual game. Its a kick ass platformer. I love the art style and I think that it combines the right amount of difficulty with extremely tight and accurate controls. I havn't enjoyed a TANP as much as LOVE since Super Meat Boy. If you're into this style of game, then I can't reccomend this game enough. Not only are you getting a great game, you're also helping a great person.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003910945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1455799495}
review:
Love is such a fantastic game. 

It's a platformer that feels different. The graphics are simple but fit perfectly with this game. It makes it even more addictive. 

There are many endurance games that you give up on within minutes because it just doesn't seem worse all the annoyance. This isn't one of those games. This is one of those games that you'll 'give it one more go' over and over until you get past it.

My only suggestion for the game, would be making a way to share levels made in the level editor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009498859', 'num_games_owned': 1973, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1407252566}

author: {'steamid': '76561198098461475', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1704, 'last_played': 1564582936}
review:
[ANALISIS INICIAL]
Desde el punto de vista de un indie gamer lo unico que tengo que decir es que LOVE cumple con todas las espectativas que presenta tanto en el trailer como en las capturas. Puedes hechar horas facilmente intentando superar los complicados y enrevesados niveles de este gran juego o retÃ¡ndote a ti mismo a superar el complejo YOLO Mode en el que solo dispones de una Ãºnica vida. O incluso intentando completar los logros que Steam ofrece con este juego.
Sin duda, totalmente recomendable.

[ANALISIS TRAS LA ÃšLTIMA ACTUALIZACIÃ“N]
A ver, sobre esto habrÃ¡ diversas opiniones ya que el hecho de que incluyan mas niveles en el juego siempre es algo interesante y que suele llevar a mas y mas horas de entretenimiento, Sin embargo, en mi mas sincera opiniÃ³n, pienso que esto es demasiado. 
Cuando juegas a LOVE te acabas acostumbrando a un nivel de dificultad alto, pero sin excederse (no estamos hablando de La Mulana ni nada por el estilo). Sin embargo, estos 4 nuevos niveles me parecen muy inadecuados no por su dificultad, (sin duda mayor al resto del juego) sinÃ³ porque el cambio que se produce entre el nivel 12 y el 13 me parece demasiado atroz refiriendonos a la dificultad de los mismos, por lo tanto no puedo aceptar facilmente estos niveles. Igualmente, sigue siendo cuestiÃ³n de jugar y jugar hasta dominarlos, pero igualmente mantengo mi opiniÃ³n.
Respecto a los nuevos niveles del "remix" no tengo nada que decir ya que me han gustado mucho, Buena dificultad y bastante sorprendentes (aun siendo muchos de ellos muy parecidos a los del LOVE original)
NOTA: SegÃºn pasa el tiempo obviamente te acostumbras pero el cambio brusco se nota.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102275691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1428865842}
{'steamid': '76561197993255188', 'num_games_owned': 700, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1413600197}
review:
This game is platforming at its most basic.  The controls are exactly what they need to be for making almost but not quite pixel-perfect jumps, and the graphics, while hardly the best, offer a few well-designed visual backgrounds and are always functional enough to let you recognize what will kill you and what dangers are ahead.  The levels are well designed with just enough trickiness to offer potential traps but that the Single Life mode seems (at least to me) very much possible, some day, with enough practice.  And the levels are also fun, which I think is the most important part.  They are all very memorable in at least one way, and offer a variety of challenges.  They are good enough that I feel it is worth playing through the speedrun mode, and playing multiple rounds to attempt to reach A++ scores.

Basically, it is a well-crafted challenge platformer that is beatable by probably most people but also offers enough challenges that people will want to come back to it repeatedly, and is short enough that a full game is not a huge time sink and failing does not prohibit you from coming back and playing again because you felt like you spent too much time on it.  I would rank it better than average, and well worth the very low price of entry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061249750', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1473996254}
review:
Edit: Went through some of the new levels and they all radiate the same charm as the originals. All the new modes well complement it, and I dare say make them game even more worth the pittance of an asking price. Don't miss out on this hidden gem.

Love is a wonderful platformer that never fails to surprise, even after multiple playthroughs. While very short, (taking a little under an hour to play through your first time), the ability to create your own levels and the challenges they have presented throughout, with most levels hiding cool little secrets, Love keeps you occupied and engaged. While the game is technically done, the makers are consistently adding new stuff and updating quite frequently, so there will always be something to come back to.

Also, the soundtrack is absolutely gorgeous. Definitely worth checking out for the insanely low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008522548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1406079875}
review:
Cool Rage Platformer. This is just like VVVVVVV but it has 4 modes which sets it apart. there is unlimited lives mode . Standard mode : Which is 100 lives . YOLO mode , and speed run mode. the platforming doesnt seem as hard as vvvvvvv because you are not constantly fliping and trying to reorient yourself but it is hard enough. You get repawners and each toime you use a respawner you lose points towards your final score. So if you are a high score perfectionist you should love this.

Its a fun game but with how cheaply it looks like it was made I wouldnt spend more than 5 bucks on it. and thats if you love rage platformers.

review: The controls seemed clumsy with no way to rebind them to something more comfortable. Some of the death sound effects were really grating to the point I just wanted to shut the game off. It was nice being able to place a checkpoint pretty much any where you wanted, but this was a double-edged sword since if you neglected to do so, you get sent way far back. Overall it seemed like something I could like, but it just wouldn't click.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1403783933}
review: Love is a platforming game in the style of atari 2600 games but will you want to play through this game ? In the game theres no story you bassicly go through stages and thats it but is that bad ? Love is probably one of the best platformers on steam without a doubt. The game is kinda on the short side but thats not bad and this game is actually quite fun and i would suggest you to play through it at least once. Now for the good things. The game is pretty fun but at the same time challenging. The game has an amazing soundtrack which is great to hear once you jump throught the game. Graphics looks amazing for a pixel like game. Now for the bad. The game is incredibly short you can pretty much finish the game in half an hour. Some minor bugs like getting stuck in the enviroments. But thats pretty much it. Overall this game is incredibly fun and i would suggest all of you to play Love. I give Love a 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197982180511', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1446792637}
review: Love is an amazing run and jump platformer. Replay is high, if only for the achievements and for speedrun bragging rights. Great soundtrack that doesn't grate even after the dozenth listen and wonderful pixel-landscapes make a very enjoyable experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042254599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1538278688}
review: A neat little precision platformer made for those who like to punish themselves.  There's not much to it, like the others have said, and that's by design.  You are the white pixel dude, and the point is to get to the end of the level without dying, or as few times as possible.  The music is pretty cool, the controls are nice and tight (there's no way to do a game like this otherwise), and the game is short...it's a downside if you're looking for a bunch of content, but if you enjoy speedrunning, and like the idea of trying a time or two in between putting your kids down for a nap (a huge plus in my book), you'll like this.  It encourages multiple playthroughs, and did I mention the soundtrack?  Besides, it's three bucks.  I've paid just as much for mobile games that weren't half as enjoyable and that got touched twice.  Give this a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005779315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1408000093}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025631096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1404340822}
review: Love is pain. Love is suffering. Love is a minimalist platformer that, just like VVVVVV, puts your reflexes to the test in a pixelated world of eye-straining wonder. The game itself is challenging, but fair, with precise controls and an amazing soundtrack. Any mistakes you make will be your own... and that is, perhaps, the most frustrating part. If you don't mind the visuals, give Love a chance, you won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992888227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1541132943}
review:
Fantastic for a few hours of fun. Between the great electro music tailored to each level, minimalist graphics, intuitive controls, and an innovative checkpoint system, the game is a real bargain. 

Love ramps up the difficulty on some levels just enough to satisfy my Super Mario World Special World nostalgia craving. I say buy it and try it when you want something to occupy your mind for an hour or two.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080208697', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1587325133}
review: Fun game in the vein of "Super Meat Boy" or "The Impossible Game", very challenging and unforgiving, but worth the effort. The main game is relatively short, but the achievements and other game modes add to the replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964081702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1445556344}
review: I love platforming games, and this one has such charm.  I think I keep replaying it to listen to the music as much as get through it.  It's a short game by all means, but that seems to be the point.  It's a brief, mesmerizing platforming experience.  Definitely pick up this awesome little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026488684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1424207572}
review: This is the first game I have reviewed on steam.  If you like platforming, GET IT NOW!  I was amazed at how immersive this game is, something I didn't expect with the minimalistic graphics.  The levels are so cool to look at and while it is a tough platformer, it is 100% fair.  If you die it was your fault, not a glitch or something.  I recommend an xbox (or other computer) controller, it really makes this game shine.  I got this on a steam summer sale, and I almost feel guilty for it not costing more money, that's how good this is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020397289', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1500167961}
review: The creator of this game did a truly wonderful job making a pixel death simulator. There are a variety of noises that play when your boxy hero bites the dust, and get prepared to hear them over and over again! I'm one of those people that has 300~ steam games and never plays through them, but I actually went all the way through the end of this one. GREAT platformer, especially for the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037197299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1439284877}
review: Simple, short but fun platformer game with a neat and funny looking pixelated character, variety of music gives the game good atmosphere. Recommended for hardcore gamers that want to have more from the game in Yolo or Speedrun mode. Game is without a story but that makes it special to create/imagine your own story for yourself while playing. You can make your own levels with paint or photoshop, i`m curious to try this but its not neccesary to have alot more levels since i like minimalistic games, sometimes its better having less than abundance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988663774', 'num_games_owned': 3547, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1427463265}
review:
This game isn't bad or anything, but it's a fairly generic platformer with a minimalistic art style and hasn't really got anything to recommend it. I mean, I beat it in 18 minutes.

If you get in a bundle, it's probably worth playing, but I wouldn't buy it.

review: LOVE is 100%, one of the absolute best platformers I have ever played in my life. Easy to get through, hard to master, can be beat in less than 10 minutes once you work out a method. Good post-release support, easy level editor. Fantastic developer and a fantastic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037253388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1700966649}
review:
Love, what do I?
Fred Wood's Love had me wondering if it posed a moral or meaning to itself, but there is nothing.You are a small person that can run and jump. Simple? Yes. Confusing story? Indeed. In fact, there is no story. Your hasty legs speed you around world of mystery. Through a blood-red land with giant ornate blades flying through, to an ancient, rotting husk of a prehistoric creature. As you scream at the inescapeable deaths of the elements and your belittled form, you keep with the beat of the ever-pounding soundtrack. It could go from dark and ambient to upbeat and catchy. The game is in no way innovative or original, but is has some special unique charm to it. Maybe it's the industrial levels or the nonstop movement. Maybe if it asks if you love yourself, since you can either kill yourself to get ahead or spare a life for the last moment. What do you love?

author: {'steamid': '76561197996879432', 'num_games_owned': 5443, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1479939936}
review:
I really Love this game, as the name suggests. Had really good time playing and unlocking achievements. If you like games like Super Meat Boy, AVGN Game, Electronic SuperJoy etc. you will love this game. And for that price you cannot go wrong!

Edit: LOVE is Love, LOVE is Life

Edit: Looking back to this review and playing the game again after some time, I realize that this is not just a game for me, this is a symbol of something that will probably never be experienced in any game again. Some people might just look at this "game" as difficult indie platformer but for me, this is a form of Art. 

By this, I would like to thank you the developer for this life experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041010305', 'num_games_owned': 1599, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1393361600}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040573839', 'num_games_owned': 2229, 'num_reviews': 298, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1400535142}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025350632', 'num_games_owned': 3421, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1400212597}
review:
Love is an excellent, difficult platformer that is not terribly frustrating or impossible. Infact, I find the difficulty of the game to be inspiring to do better and yet still feels great when you do succeed and beat the level that is in front of you. In Love there are 4 different modes: Easy Mode (infinite lives), Normal Mode (100 lives), YOLO Mode (1 Life), and a speedrun Mode (infinite lives and a timer). Aside from Easy Mode, each mode gives you something that makes you want to do better. You try to get through the game losing fewer and fewer lives, or seeing how far 1 life can get you, or how quickly you can beat the whole thing. I also liked how the game allows you to make your own checkpoints. There is no checkpoint to reach in the game, you can put one down in almost any place. I feel that this makes the game a lot less frustrating as you no longer have to repeat any actions that you have already done.

Overall, Love is a good game and I think that it is well worth the $3 regular price and is a must buy for any sale price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997792412', 'num_games_owned': 1200, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1558730878}
review:
LOVE is a fun little platformer game with easy and tight controls. You have your movement keys, jump and the ability to set a respawn point - now get to the end. 

There are 12 levels in the main game + 10 extra ones that aren't in the main exe for some reason. It can be beaten easily in 30 minutes if you take your time and speedruns usually take 10 minutes. The fun I found in LOVE was the race to get a better score and speedrun it as fast as possible, coupled with some hidden achievements and Its a party. There's a one life only mode for the truly badass people out there - also fun to play with friends and see who can get the furthest.

For such a small game, I wouldn't expect the soundtrack to be so diverse but surprisingly Its quite listenable and I wouldn't mind having it in my library of game soundtracks. Calm, smooth and complimenting the 8bit art style.

Although unnecessary, I'd still love the see the ability to rebind keys and steam workshop support for custom levels would really be the icing on the cake. As it stands, you can get bored of the initial 12 levels pretty quickly.

If you're looking to try a simple obstacle course platformer, not too difficult but certainly not easy, give it a try. If you're looking for something hardcore, reminiscent of "I Wanna Be The Guy", maybe look elsewhere but try LOVE just the same - in YOLO mode, tell me how that works out for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037930780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1399449523}
review:
A short, simple platformer, where the main mechanic is that you get to set your own check-points.  With the press of a button, you set down a new check-point, and if you die, you respawn at the checkpoint you set.

At first this seems to be an easy way to essentially breeze through the game, but in later levels you have less and less areas to place your check-points that are safe, or possible at all.  For instance, a long sequence of bouncing on platforms gives you no opportunity to make the check-point you so desperately desire.

The system works really well, and leads to a pretty fun little game.

The level design is creative and interesting.  My favorite levels are feel like they could be a part of something larger.  There is a hint of a greater universe that is never shown to us, and isn't meant to be known.  

All of this, and if you're interested in speed-running, the game has a built in speed-runner mode.  The interplay between the check-point mechanic and speed-running works rather well, so this is a welcome addition, and should give you a good reason to replay.

All together, I would definitely recommend this game, especially considering the low price being asked for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999338782', 'num_games_owned': 5564, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1398623933}
review:
Love es uno de esos juegos simples que acabas por amar o aborrecer, sin termino medio. En mi caso me ha encantado. Me recuerda al VVVVVV pero un poco menos frenÃ©tico. Uno de esos juegos que te enseÃ±an que el apartado grÃ¡fico no lo es todo y lo jugable puede hacer que un juego sea una tremenda basura o un gran titulo. En este caso, triunfa.

Simple, rÃ¡pido y directo. Inicias, tienes 100 vidas y hasta donde llegues. Ya esta. A partir de ahÃ­ es mejorar, pasarte los niveles sin morir, sacar los logros, encontrar los secretos, hacer algunas hazaÃ±as complicadas y luego, si tienes valor, completar el juego con tan solo una vida (MisiÃ³n imposible xD).

El aspecto grÃ¡fico le queda genial, no esta sobrecargado y los niveles tiene cierto trasfondo, algunas partes son un poco confusas pero se disfruta.
Ademas, el titulo tiene una mÃºsica muy buena que le pega genial.
 Adictivo, en cuanto terminas de jugarlo ya sea por que se te agotan las 100 vidas o por que llegas al final quieres volver a intentarlo para sacar mejor puntuaciÃ³n y logros.

Por 3 euros lo comprarÃ­a sin dudar. Si lo ves por menos, es una compra casi obligada si te gustan este tipo de juegos.

Lo bueno:
-Es un juego directo, sin intros que no pegan nada o tutoriales liosos.
-Simple a la vez que complejo, puedes pasarte el juego a la segunda pero no podrÃ¡s conseguir pasÃ¡rtelo sin morir... nunca xD
-La mÃºsica le queda perfecta.
-Rejugable.
-Editor de niveles, en este tipo de juegos siempre es de agradecer.
-Control con mando bastante pulido.
-Aun que esta en ingles se entiende todo a la perfecciÃ³n.

Lo malo:
-La duraciÃ³n, para variar. Si no te gusta sacar logros y eres de los que se pasa el juego una sola vez te va a durar, como mucho, mucho, una hora. Si por el contrario vas a sacarte todo, puede durar 2-3 horas como mucho.
-Se echa un poco en falta algo de mas contenido. Pantallas oficiales o mas logros para extender la vida del juego.
-La accesibilidad a las tablas de clasificaciÃ³n y el editor de mapas, ambas cosas un poco escondidas.

ConclusiÃ³n:
Si no lo tuviese ya, por 3 euros me lo comprarÃ­a otra vez. Si te gustan juegos de plataformas y algo desafiantes (VVVVVV, Bloody Trapland etc..) este te gustara, es igual que los anteriores mencionados pero un poco mas relajado.
Perfecto para echar una tarde muerta y volver a rejugarlo pasado un tiempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970705636', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1705685424}
review:
Quite intrigued from the sound of it, you buy yourself into a world of platforming with a not quite fleshed out concept. Love is arguably the most bare-bone platformer you will ever encounter, and I'm talking beyond ImagineMe-level of basic. The levels mostly are free of thematic consistancy. And although you can notice a certain degree of development within your environment, it deosn't build up to anything.
The save state function seems to be more of an excuse for the clunky controlls and awkward unrebindable keymapping.

Wait for at leat 50% discount on this title, and till dev put some gradients into the color-scheme.
3$/â‚¬ is way too much to ask for a flash game!

review:
Absolutely worth playing.

I'm the type of person that rarely plays a game for more than an hour or so so I loved that I beat the game in about a half hour and perfectly timed at 1 life left.  Good simple platformer with good, but not frustrating, challenge.

I'm sure I ended up with this in my library through a bundle somewhere and I'm glad I decided to play it out of random.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087697828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1401053279}
review: I only played for 45 minutes. It's short. I finished the game in that amount of time. I am not saying Love is a bad game which it's not. I am just saying there should be more levels. All you do is beat one course and then you are done. The music in love is okay. I didn't find any of the songs stuck in my head I found them floating in one ear and out the other. There was one level when the music was so....I don't think I should say "bad" but I wanted to finish the level so I wouldn't have to hear the music! The levels are hard! I found myself dead at least 300 times. Overall if you want a game that is short tand is a platformer. This is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033497693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1396670502}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042311190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1394142034}
review:
This game is freakin' EXCELLENT, man.

The controls are tight, the '100 lives' mechanic is a great concept, and the music is excellent.  I'm a huge fan of the respawn system - you can set a respawn point whereever you want, which keeps the game moving forward nicely even if you're finding a section difficult.  The visuals are very minimal but pleasant to look at regardless.

A playthrough of the game is short, for sure, but it's cheap and it has LOTS of replay value - the main challenge comes in beating your own time and score, doing a speedrun or trying to beat the monstrously difficult YOLO mode (it's so hardddddd).  

That said, although I'm really enjoying it, it would be nice if some more levels were added in the future.  It certainly wouldn't hurt.

If you're a fan of challenging platformers like Super Meat Boy or VVVVVV, there's no excuse for not owning this, cause it'll be perfect for you.  If you're on the fence, just buy it.  It's fun, it's cheap and it has more than enough replay value to make up for its short run time.  

I LOVE it. 

...get it?  Ahahahahahahahahaha *sigh*

author: {'steamid': '76561197963057362', 'num_games_owned': 4656, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1395048459}
review:
This is a strange mix for me personally, that I genuinely enjoy so far. The music is comforting and relaxing and the deaths do not punish you as any level platform you can set your respawn on with no penalty to gameplay. I played it with my 7yr old son who picked up each levels mechanics so fast it surprised me seeing him finish a few levels when I was playing was a great experience.

The levels look simple, accuracy is the key and the layer movement is totally in your hands allowing you to correct the trajectory as you go (which also means, when you die it is your fault, and not rage inducing).  The aesthetics are perfectly suited to the game and I have enjoyed this a lot more than I feel I would have.

If you are after a fun platformer that will reward your persistence and attention to the levels, this should draw you in. Super Meat Boy is a comparison but I don't feel it is a fair one as SMB relishes punishing you at every turn to make you respawn and repeat (giving you surprise and cheap feeling deaths) this on the other hand has few of these so far and the mechanics feel solid.

I played this with a 360 gamepad and controls were perfect, the sense of movement really felt spot on and accurate.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975703239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1455378974}
review: A fairly easy platformer with a very pleasing aesthetic that is meant to be a short bitsized game. An appetizer of an appetizer if you will. These days where games are a dime a dozen this is actually refreshing. Sure I'll forget about it years from now, but do you really remember that one game you played for 20 minutes in Toys R US when you were in sixth grade and had a blast with? I didn't think so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024805655', 'num_games_owned': 609, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1637772432}
review:
Love is a fairly difficult precision-based platformer with a retro/pixelated aesthetic. Simple in concept, excellent in execution.

It's short, completable within 15 minutes, but the replay value is very high due to performance-based achievements, online highscore boards, and speedrun mode (focusing purely on speedy completion times). The controls are very tight, and the manually placed respawn points are a neat mechanic that adds a bit of depth to the gameplay. Love's level design is very appealing and flows nicely, despite a couple of difficulty spikes here and there, and the retro theme is brilliantly complimented by the game's soundtrack.

The only real gripe I have is how a couple of levels require an ounce of memorization, leaving you with no way of knowing if you're leaping to your death if it's your first or second run. Other than that and the difficulty spikes I briefly mentioned earlier, it's hard for me to give Love any more serious criticism.

For $3, fans of platformers or challenging games in general will not be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067845679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1487652494}
review:
[b]Love is great.[/b]

Ah, [b]Love[/b]. A platformer that reflects mountain king and various other platformers for Atari and MSDOS systems. It was a joy for me to see this. To see that someone focused on simplicity other than making the next cookie-cutter movie production, I was excited to buy this.

The game is addicting, difficult, and charming, in the simplest of ways. For one, there are no cheap deaths. You can get past any obstacle, and beat any level if you just practice to know what's coming. Another great thing about it is the respawn system, nice touch for a platformer of this style. Most of all though, I love the soundtrack. I calms you down if you're about to rage from a death. Good stuff.

Overall, [b]Love[/b] is a great game that you should just buy. The job that the designer did on this game is something I really appreciate as a dev myself, and you should as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001716361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1531199559}
review:
Love hurts, love scars, love wounds and mars any heart not tough or strong enough. To take a lot of pain, take a lot of pain; love is like a cloud, holds a lot of rain (contaminated rain). Love hurts... when the game ends too soon. 

Either way, the song Love Hurts describes this game quite well, it's a great game for speed running and relies mostly on jumping, running and completing the game as soon as possible. For more of a challenge, there's also a YOLO mode where you can only die once. Pretty good game with an Atari-like world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042324050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1423877402}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064549326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1394413736}
review:
While I loved the minimalistic retro visuals and the quite unique soundtrack at first, it got to the 50th respawn before it got tedious. Now I've played They Bleed Pixels, and Super Meat Boy, so I knew what to expect when it claimed that it was difficult, but those games kept things interesting. Love just feels like it's missing something, maybe I'm just not ready for it yet. 

Love is a cruel mistress afterall.

Maybe I expected too much, in which case the game is not at fault. All I can say is if you like challenging platformers that may induce rage, this is for you. For the price, it's a little game that'll pay back in curse words and eventually fist pumping joy - go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047988034', 'num_games_owned': 2204, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1408289687}
review:
Retro look? âœ“
Chiptune soundtrack? âœ“
Replayability? âœ“
Fast-paced gameplay? âœ“
Ranks? Achievements? Speedrunning? âœ“
Challenging (but not cheap -except in two spots on level 1- nor frustrating) difficulty? âœ“

Its simplicity is its best offer. In this platformer there are no upgrades or foes, the environment is your only enemy in the 12 levels of the game. It has a great original feature: you can save (nearly) wherever you want, as long as you're standing on a surface (like savestates in an emulator), but the more checkpoints you create (and the more lives you lose), the worse your final rank will be.
You can select between infinite lives, 100 lives or 1 single life.
It's very short (there's an achievement for completing the game under 10 minutes) but if you're going for all achievements or simply getting a good rank it will keep you entertained a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076721797', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1404415271}
review:
This is a game that exists for replayability's sake, so if you don't like that kind of thing, just don't even look into it, it's about 15-20 minutes for your firstt playthrough and even less for further playthroughs, and not worth it if you only plan to play it once.

If you're crazy like me though and like replaying games to improve at them this one certainly does a nice job applying that concept. The respawn system and level select both help in learning the levels and the levels aren't stupidly precise or really too challenging your first time through anyways. There's a few issues with blind jumps but aside from those it's all pretty great. Each of the 12 levels is unique and the developer did well to cram as many ideas as possible into a small game like this. The graphics are also pretty nice for their style, not blocky and ugly like a lot of games adopting a "retro' style feel they need to be. I mean yeah it's pixellated and all but whatever.
Neat little game, and for the price I can't help but recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998785170', 'num_games_owned': 1759, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1392481584}
review: It's always a good sign when I forget to either keep playing a game or retire it for a couple weeks straight. I did genuinely enjoy playing through this a couple times, and I was at least considering sticking with it a bit longer to improve my time/die less, but it completely slipped my mind after a day or so. Guess it made less of an impression than I thought. I do like some of the level design, and the respawn mechanic and extremely generous number of lives make it relatively easy to complete the game but incentivize you to not abuse either if you want to be competitive at all, because you're penalized if you do. That's pretty well thought out and makes it very accessible to learn the level layouts but still requires a decent amount of skill to do well at. Yay for good design decisions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022997080', 'num_games_owned': 2142, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1393251466}
review:
Fred Wood's [i]Love[/i] is one of the most outwardly basic looking games you can find on Steam this side of Super Hexagon. Its visuals don't exactly demand attention, and to an outsider probably seems just another soulless 2D platformer which would be better served adorning a no-name website as a free flash game than something they'd want to pay for. But like the polygonal twitch-fest I mentioned earlier, what sets Love apart is its attention to detail; the way it feels, how well each level is designed, and the potential that waiting just below the service that make it far more than the average browser-based diversion.

It shouldn't be unexpected, but you should know Love is not a long game. It consists of twelve short levels which can be blown through in about 20-30 minutes your first time. This is intentional however as you aren't meant to playthrough the game once and be done with it, but return again and again to aim for higher scores, faster times, and a better ranking. This is the focus of Love and why the short levels work so well; it makes it extremely easy to jump back in for a quick run every now and then to better your time, without having to commit hours to what could potentially be no better than the last time you played. I'm not typically a fan of speedrunning, but I've already gone through Love four times and definitely see myself coming back for more.

None of this would matter though if it wasn't for how well constructed the different aspects of Love are. Each level is unique in both structure and visual design, and yet they fit together perfectly and compliment each other with their diverse layouts. Similarly the graphics are very basic, but there's a subtle elegance to the way the character moves; how the different environment colors contrast to outline traps and the path forward and how the excellent soundtrack perfectly matches the mood of them, from melancholy ambiance to hyperactive electronica. The controls are sharp, whether using a controller or keyboard (the latter of which I rarely will even attempt to use), and something about the way you move just "feels right".

I'll come out and say I, ahem, Love [i]Love[/i]. It surprised me with its addictive and refined design, and has me eager to see what developer Fred Wood has planned for future updates. There is a ton of potential here for such a seemingly simple game and I have no doubt he is going to tap into it, already showing an admiral dedication to patching out bugs and adding in features that didn't make it right at launch. Love might not be a long game, or a very deep one, but it is certainly a very enjoyable little slice of platforming that is well worth the very low cost of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037900375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1442843931}
review:
Hard yes.

Fans of Quick-Play or Speedrun games and traditional Platformers shouldn't shy away from this game. Sure, it looks like it belongs to the Pre-Commodre 64 era (Pre-8 bit for you youngins), but that doesn't hurt it one bit; the dangers and other elements are painfully clear due to the simple contrasts of the restricted colour scheme and well, if you need your 2D platformers to be pretty all the time then you should turn away now.

Love, by Fred Wood & Co., is built to challenge your classic platforming co-ordination and that's mostly what the game consists of, careful timing and just enough foresight and momentum carries the day... or your avatar into death. Rather than use a checkpoint system at set flagged locations like many classics, Love differs in that you can set your respawn points to conserve progress, and even goes so far as to include a suicide option that allows you return to your respawn. It's not necessary but it's handy if you're too bothered to retrace your studious steps; this mode is unavailable in YOLO mode because well, YOLO, but becomes useful to cover mistakes during Speedrun mode.

However, if you like your games longer, you should maybe look elsewhere; once you get better at this game, you'll only find yourself clocking it at faster times. If you take into account how long that might take you, well, then thats where this game really sells itself on replayability in the way that many old games with timers would, daring you not to die before it runs out... Only there's no timer counting down, just all the other players to beat... Or just yourself.

Pros:

-A challenging Quickplay, designed with 4 modes to cater to multiple player types: Easy for learners, Standard to try to keep 100 lives, YOLO mode for the Carpe Diem in you, and Speedrun for the obvious
-A brief but informative tutorial mode
-Features tight controls, unlike the era it imitates graphically
-Can toggle sounds/music on and off
-Can adjust to full screen (4:3) or scaled windows (1x-4x)
-Has a jukebox mode to listen to music
-Compelling melodic soundtrack, 12 tunes matched to 12 levels
-Oh yeah, 12 varying levels to master in the original, with an extra 10 added via Love + Custom
-Controller support

Neutrals (AKA matter of taste/opinion):
-Atari 2600-esque Retro graphics themes
-Cheap but well-priced

Cons:

-No adjustable volume controls, audio is either off or on
-No remappable/editable key or button inputs - anyone who doesn't like the control scheme will have to resort to other methods, persist or walk away from the game
-Lack of internal widescreen support may bother some people
-Love + Custom lacks controller support and the configuration features of the original executable

author: {'steamid': '76561197999340723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1482897061}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979036698', 'num_games_owned': 941, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1392598402}
review:
A great snack-sized platformer.  The trailer gives a good idea of what to expect in terms of minimalist pixel art and atmospheric soundtrack.  Each level has its own feel, and several introduce new gameplay elements - like moving platforms on a track, or falling through the "slow tube" and dodging spikes.

A clever game mechanic is that you can set a respawn point anywhere you stand.  If you use lots of respawn points, you can retry failed jump almost instantly, so the difficulty level is very gentle.  Or, you can try for an A (or A++) score, which means using few or respawns - that takes the difficulty level up closer to Super Meat Boy territory.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989384438', 'num_games_owned': 3309, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1392891520}
review:
"Love" is an endurance platformer with an Atari aesthetic.

First point to make is about the price. At full price, it's still cheaper than most games even with a big discount. The reason for this is that the game is very small. If you've watched the trailer, you've pretty much seen the entire game.

As is the way with most platformers, you simply jump through each level and make your way to the end. You can place checkpoints whenever and wherever you wish, but each time you do so will drop your score significantly. The main appeal of the game is to try and get the highest score (and lowest time) possible, fitting Atari gameplay with the overall look.

The whole game can be completed in well under 10 minutes. I was personally able to finish it in 9 and there was plenty of room for improvement there too. If you are looking for a lot of content, you won't find it here. This game is specifically designed to appeal to speedrunners and platformer purists.

The graphics are extremely basic. Each level consists of a single colour, plus black and white. This highly pixelled look is not just for show, it is to help with the precision platforming element where the edges of platforms are absolute. This makes unfair deaths by missing platforms because you didn't quite land on the edge practically non-existent.

The audio is similarly basic. There are a few chiptune-type tracks playing on each level but none of them are particularly good. Sound effects are sparse, mainly because nothing happens. Dying and bouncing on "bouncers" are the only times you'll hear anything. The few existing sound effects fit the theme well enough.

It's hard to give a recommendation for this game because there is a limited audience for it. If you love platformer games and want a game to properly test your skills, this is the perfect game to do so. It throws enough variety in level design to keep you on your feet and encourages you to keep trying to get that perfect score.

If there were ever a graduation exam for platformer gamers, this would be it. A gauntlet of differently laid out levels that must be conquered in a single sitting, with a no-nonsense audio/visual theme and some simple, yet tight controls to boot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963247737', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1392857241}
review: It's hard to recommend love. On one hand, it's really adorable old school in it's graphics. It does really innovative things with it's respawns and I love the different modes. BUT, the controls seem to be purposely sluggish to emulate the old atari esque games and that is just unforgivable. If I'm playing a platformer, I want to feel like I'm in control of my character, but the jump button can be mysteriously awful, causing me to feel like my deaths were because of shotty controls than anything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054542665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1404733492}
review:
Well for 2 pounds your getting 1 heck of a game! As i started i didnt rlly like it but then i kinda got the hang of it i love the soundtracks which make game more ermersive and the fact it is hard but not unfair. This game as endless playablility as you can try and beat your high score or try and go a level harder. Unfortunately i would like to save to this game on one of the levels as it is quite annoying if you have to go somewere and then you got to start the whole thing over again. Yet its a masterpiece one  of the best retro/indie games i have played and hats off you the dev. Although i havent played alot im planning to play more.
SO PLEASE BUY THIS GAME!

review:
Nazwa moÅ¼e byÄ‡ mylÄ…ca - to nie Å¼aden symulator randkowy. Jedyna miÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡, jaka tu wystÄ™puje, to ta od autora do swojego dzieÅ‚a, ewentualnie nasza do jego gry.

MoÅ¼emy mieÄ‡ ich nieskoÅ„czonoÅ›Ä‡, 100 lub tylko jedno(Yolo Mode). Po utracie wszystkich zaczynamy caÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡ od nowa, nie ma czegoÅ› takiego jak save. Z drugiej strony, to tylko 11 plansz.

Grafika to same piksele, ale mimo to poziomy sÄ… zrobione bardzo Å‚adnie. KaÅ¼dy w innych kolorach, z rÃ³Å¼nymi ksztaÅ‚tami. Jeden z nich to wnÄ™trze gada - Å›wietna robota. Muzyka, choÄ‡ teÅ¼ jakby wyciÄ…gniÄ™ta z dawnych czasÃ³w, wpada w ucho.

Najciekawszy tryb to Speedrun, gdzie liczy siÄ™ czas, iloÅ›Ä‡ utraconych Å¼yÄ‡ i postawionych checkpointÃ³w. Bo ta gra jest stworzona do bicia rekordÃ³w. KrÃ³tka, nie tolerujÄ…ca bÅ‚Ä™dÃ³w. Ludzie uwielbiajÄ…cy rywalizacjÄ™ na liÅ›cie rekordÃ³w powinni siÄ™gaÄ‡ po ten tytuÅ‚ bez wahania, tym bardziej Å¼e jest bardzo tani, nawet kiedy nie ma Å¼adnych promocji.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022154407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1401436771}
review: You have infinite placeable respawns, 100 lives, and a labyrinth of 12 levels ahead of you. How far can you get? That's the concept. There's an element of exploration and satisfaction that comes into play from getting to that next level and having to figure out how to best solve the next given platforming challenge with the least number of deaths and respawns placed (not to mention speed, cause doing stuff fast is dope.) Before you know it you're finding the optimal paths through each level and building runs to try and improve your end game score. Of course, since the creed of this game is its minimalism, it becomes exponentially smaller the second you figure out a particular segment, and while some might consider this a flaw I absolutely do not. How long I played a simple game like this, how much thought I put into and how much pure fun I had with it is a testament to how great all of these minimalist pieces of it work together. And I'm still chasing that YOLO run! I love Love and I think you will too so just stop reading this and give it a dang try right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027211139', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1403197694}
review: I was very suprised about how much I enjoyed this game.  A clean and simple platformer, wiith a fun playing style.  Unlike so many modern platformers, the difficulty isn't set to 11, it is tricky but not impossible.  It is short, but timed playthroughs and the  various achievements add the playability, and the price makes it great value.  I also loved all the hidden extras, like short cuts and hidden rooms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060140920', 'num_games_owned': 1691, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1441054903}
review: Love is one of the best platformers I have ever played. Yes I mean it. This game has a basic but charming art style. The controls are tight and very responsive. Overall this game is charming. So far I love this game (See what I did there? xD). I would definitely recommend you getting this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063241796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1572223624}
review: This is challenging yet simple game and good very fun. Patience and quick reflexes are a must to master this game but you'll find muscle memory starts to kick in after a while.  The music is some of the best of its style I've heard in a game and put me in mind of the soundtrack to Cave Story+. I also felt hints of Terry Cavanagh's work in the graphical style and difficulty curve, though this is nowhere near as hard as VVVVVV, it's closer to 'Don't Look Back'. At Â£1.99 its well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006588125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1575828491}
review:
Well I dunno about the game because I cannot play it...I keep getting this error whenever I try to run it.  http://lookpic.com/O/i2/536/C92KUOYL.png  Contacted the creator, Fred Wood (fred.t.wood@gmail.com), and his response was just that he had never heard of that error before.  If anyone else could help me out that'd be great...not to mention turn the negative review into a positive one.

UPDATE:

Changed from bad to good...Thank you for finally fixing the problem for me and works amazingly.  If you enjooy N+, I wanna be the guy, vvvvvv, or games of that nature the answer is yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991394700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1393479374}
review:
This is an exceedingly pretty game. The music is beautiful and the visuals are easily one of the better examples of retro graphics out there. 

The gameplay itself is quite good, the controls feel nice and the difficulty is at a nice level where you feel challenged but not frustrated. Unfortunatly the game is very short (~18min for my first playthrough) and quite of few of the levels feel like they should be longer. Despite that the game is great and I will definitly keep an eye out for more stuff from Fred Wood.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964410359', 'num_games_owned': 5234, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1705616892}
review: Jeu de plateforme minimaliste, d'inspiration graphique disons VVVVVV mais qui n'en a ni la difficultÃ©, ni la bande son. Premier run (= jeu plus ou moins terminÃ©) en 18 minutes, ici c'est certain vous n'en aurez pas pour votre argent, deuxiÃ¨me run on tente le speedrun direct (l'achievement est Ã  10 minutes), succÃ¨s avec un run en 9 minutes 30, aprÃ¨s il reste plus qu'Ã  YOLO (finir le jeu sans mourir, c'est pÃ©nible mais sans plus, le jeu Ã©tant bien moins difficile qu'un meat boy Ã  part un ou deux passage ou il faut assurer), et le dernier achievement est ... de mourir 999 fois :D Bon ben normalement il faut bien moins de mort que Ã§a pour terminer, donc bon, scotch sur la manette et en avant vers le trou Ã  cÃ´tÃ© du dÃ©but ! Au final pour le prix je recommanderais pas, y a vraiment pas de quoi jouer longtemps, mais bon si jamais vous le rÃ©cupÃ©rez dans un bundle et que vous avez une heure Ã  tuer, Ã§a peut le faire :)

review: Difficult, but the frustration never gets obnoxious. If you like old school platforming, I highly recommend this one. Has a nice style and simple and intuitive mechanics that even work well with a keyboard, and that spawn point making mechanic was a stroke of genius.

ã—ã‹ã—ã‚¯ãƒªã‚¢å¾Œã«ä¸€æ™‚çš„ã«è©•ä¾¡ãŒè¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚Œã‚‹ã®ã¿ã§ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ å†…ã§ã‚¹ã‚³ã‚¢ã‚„ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãªã©ã®ãƒ©ãƒ€ãƒ¼è¡¨ç¤ºæ©Ÿèƒ½ãŒãªã„ã®ã§é ‘å¼µã£ã¦ã‚‚ã‚¤ãƒã‚¤ãƒå¼µã‚Šåˆã„ãŒãªã„ã®ã¯æƒœã—ã„ã€‚

author: {'steamid': '76561197974544461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1392519991}
review:
Love is a minimalistic platformer that feels like a shorter, more forgiving, more linear version of VVVVVV. Unlike the open-world levels of VVVVVV, Love's are completely "Point A to Point B" from one to the next. There's also a helpful respawn mechanic that allows you to manually place respawn points as you progress, making death less frustrating than in other similar titles. The game is fairly short although I consider that a positive (ideal for short bursts) and totally acceptable given the low pricepoint. Many people should have no problem finishing all 12 levels in under 30 minutes and more experienced players can finish in under 10. Despite the short length, there's a decent amount of replayability thanks to the scoring system that grades you upon completion as well as the speedrun mode. I was also fond of the excellent soundtrack which features a nice mix of soothing and uptempo.

In all, Love is a fun, simple, and well-designed 2D platformer without any unwanted filler. Absolutely worth the $3 pricetag.

review: Este juego me lo regalo mi novio, la verdad no pense que me llegara a gustar. es super interesante y aunque no lo he jugado mucho porque me estresan un poco este tipo de juegos me encanta. lo recomiendo al 100%, perfecto para jugar para pasar el rato y estas cansado de jugar siempre lo mismo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963352726', 'num_games_owned': 3693, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1392437070}
review:
THEY CALLED IT LOVE BECAUSE RAGE WAS ALREADY TAKEN.

A difficult but fair platformer with incredible music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082134568', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1465264674}
review: Difficult little bugger this is. But the clever naming of "Love" made me think. Downloaded, played and immidiatley (I can't spell) HATED the game, the controlls were sensitive, and i kept dieing. That's a comon theme of this game. Dieing. Alot. I rage quitted a few times. Ok, 50 times. But eventually, I got used to the controlls. And I realized that it was not the controlls,it was the sheer dificulty. And that's when my love grew strong. (See what i did there?) From that point on this game had (and still is) me hooked. I love this really difficult game. I though would personally suggest mod support, button remaping, and a damn volume slider. Music is great, but either mealowed, or enraged me (Or my anger for it). I will recomend it. Great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012952042', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1392428363}
review:
Very short game, though, really throws you back to the older and simpler platformers. You jump, and you dodge. Very simple game for casual players, but can also be very fun for hardcore platform gamers like speedrunners (there's a speedrun game mode).

My only negative point is I wished the game was a bit harder at times, but I guess they made up for it with the game mode YOLO (1 life)

author: {'steamid': '76561197968056472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1392428961}
review: Really good experience on this one.  Great atmosphere, perfect length.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084859992', 'num_games_owned': 1459, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1399174775}
review:
Amazing hardcore, retro style platformer. If you loved (pun intended) VVVVV, you'll love Love. The YOLO and Speedrun mode will make you break your keyboard/controller in pieces.

and it's CHEAP! 

Can't get better than that!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120589463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1392784120}
review:
Want to master Super Meat Boy? Play this and in a few hours, you'll have skills you never knew. 
Great learning curve, incredible replayability, a meditative ambiance and a level editor so you can create your own challenges. 
I want to shake the developers hand.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998159285', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1395019765}
review: Seems like a bad clone of VVVVV, but in reality; its actually pretty darn sweet! Recommended if you like Super Meat Boy! Also, try to beat YOLO mode. I'm sure you will be able to win. (Hint: Its almost impossible.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198112270216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1395312140}
review:
This game is just beautiful even if they don't put that much colors. It is simple and addictive. It is on Early Access but it is even good.
I recommend this game for those who loves to play platformer games and for those who love to do speedruns. Oh yes the speedruns are EXTREMELY fun to do in this game.
Not only the Speedrun mode is fun but the YOLO Mode (Literally) is satisfyingly good if you beat it. But it gets pretty annoying if you died manytimes cos you have only 1 life. The game is not extremely hard like I Wanna Be The Boshy or Super Meat Boy but it is quite challenging to do on YOLO Mode.
Although, there is not much too explore and the game is short IMO. The game is sooooo linear. For those who like to find explore the beautiful atmosphere, THIS IS NOT THE GAME FOR YOU GUYS!
Anyways this game is fun with no storylines or whatsoever. (Oh and it is cheap too cos it is on the Early Access.)

I give it 7/10 MAN Pump

author: {'steamid': '76561197999757048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1422204305}
review:
This game has some serious poetential.
You can slightly, just ever so slightly compare it to the same objective of Super Mario. Complete the levels and do not fall.

I am aware it is being perfected, step by step in the making; but it was very worth the $2 it was on sale for at the time, and definitely provides some fun, and while may be a bit frustrating at times; it actually edges you to continue playing. It's especially great that you can set up respawn points (by pressing S).

Besides, #yolomode!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093708963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1395239893}
review: I haven't spent too much time with Love yet. Plan on digging into it today. However, from what I've seen, it's a gorgeous, tough-as-nails platformer with wonderful music and a minimalist art-style that really speaks to my classic side. There's a kind attention to detail when it comes to platform layout, and despite the difficulty, nothing ever feels cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116882611', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1552747556}
review: For only 2 american dollars, this game is worth it. Think VVVVV, but instead of gravity flipping, think making checkpoints. There is a YOLO mode with only one life, and it is freaking hard. Even on standard, this game is hard. I don't know what Custom mode is, gonna try it. Overall, worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066769522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1453599955}
review: lo iba a comprar en desura, pero bueno estaba de oferta en steam, el juego para ser simple es una magia, es bastante entretinido, con la mÃºsica que tiene, relaja, yo digo que vale la pena, es barato y ahora de oferta hasta el 14 de febrero, love sin duda un muy buen juego

author: {'steamid': '76561198064509517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1392170913}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067784407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1392953124}
review: I get a really great Jumpman (Epyx, 1983) vibe from this.  That's a good thing.  I loved Jumpman as a kid.  (Yeah, showing my age.)  This game has far better motion than Jumpman, the levels are very different, and the music is excellent.  I sucked at Jumpman, and so far I suck at Love, but it's still great fun.  Maybe I'll get better with some more practice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097720560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1431557514}
review:
I went into this not knowing what to expect, only knowing that it was $2 and if I didn't enjoy it, well, it was only $2.

I absolutely loved the game! :D Certainly was a pleasant surprise for the small amount they're asking. Yeah, it's short, but there's plenty of potential for the game, especially with the level editor. Definitely recommend getting this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085962531', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1460682570}
review:
I know this game is in early access, looks good from my dew minutes of gameplay, but there is a reason for only about 3 mintues of gameplay. I found the control scheme weird. Me, being used to the WASD & Mouse configuration, took me a bit to understand how to control the character. I found it hard to navigate the menu, not knowing you had to use the A key to proceed to that option. If there was a way you could rebind the keys, i think that would improve this game so so much.

Apart from that, all the gameplay i've watched of this game seems good, other reviews seem very positive, and it looks like an all round fun game to play. Would recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001933176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1394718241}
review: Love is a great game and has chill music. The updates are improving gameplay day by day (fixing sounds, menus, etc). All in all, the game very fun for it's price. The only cons currently are some achievement issues and that YOLO mode. God damn, YOLO mode is tough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977871703', 'num_games_owned': 971, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1437289691}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078369212', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1468530352}
review:
This game is beautiful.

While I haven't spent a great deal of time playing it, I will continue to play it for a long time that's for sure!
From the music, to the beautifully simple graphics, the game just flows, being able to set your respawn point was a neat feature too. Each level is amazingly designed, the graphics are so simple yet just mesmerising.
I bought this game not knowing what to expect as there were no reviews, boy am I glad I bought it!

If you love platformers and a bit of a challenge, then LOVE is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073852342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1586448254}
review:
Bonjour messieurs, dames, et preparez-vous Ã  entrer dans une dimension oÃ¹ les Jean-Kevin ce sont pendus depuis longtemps, oÃ¹ on y pratique le sadomashochisme et oÃ¹ les crises de nerfs sont devenue courant! Messieurs; dames, entrez dans le monde ... du platformer! *roullement d'tonerre*

Le gameplay de love est simple: 4 boutons: avant, arriere, sauter et quicksave! Le jeu est pour l'instant en "early acces", mais reste bien abouite pour l'instant, les niveaux sont variÃ©s, changant Ã  chaque fois de level disigne et de gameplay, osillant entre les sauts au poil de fion et et les plateformes qui disparaient, n'est en moins, il n'est pas clichÃ©, il aurait pue facillement prendre les niveaux eau,glace et lave mais prefere soit changer le designe pour que cela paraisse different (ex: la lave), soit completement virer les niveau a la c** (nan mais arreter quoi, les niveaux de glace, c'etaient pas marrant au debut, ca risque pas de l'etre aujourd'hui, ce que jeu comprend tres bien)!

Et pour les adeptes des trophÃ©s steam, comme moi, ces dernier sont asser retorce Ã  avoire mais pas impossible, le jeu est meme fais pour etre speedrunner avec, par exemple, beaucoup de raccourice et un mode avec un chrono (qui s'appelent "speedru", on n'invente rien :) ! 

Il manquerait plus qu'un editeur de niveau, du vostfr et un scenar "portaleux" pour que le jeu devienne une bombe indÃ©e!
